description.original: A search engine that just works
description.translation: A search engine that just works

dict.Notice(`Omnisearch - Started non-localho: Notice(`Omnisearch - Started non-localhost HTTP server at ${e.settings.DANGER_httpHost}:${n}`,12e4)
dict.Notice(`Omnisearch - Started HTTP server: Notice(`Omnisearch - Started HTTP server on port ${n}`)
dict.Notice(`Omnisearch - Cannot start HTTP s: Notice(`Omnisearch - Cannot start HTTP server on ${n}. See console for more details.`)
dict.Notice(\"Omnisearch - Cache missing or i: Notice("Omnisearch - Cache missing or invalid. Some freezes may occur while Omnisearch indexes your vault.")
dict.Notice(\"Omnisearch - Cache cleared. Ple: Notice("Omnisearch - Cache cleared. Please restart Obsidian.")
dict.Notice(\"Omnisearch - Your index cache m: Notice("Omnisearch - Your index cache may be incorrect or corrupted. If this message keeps appearing, go to Settings to clear the cache.",5e3)
dict.Notice(\"Omnisearch - Error while creati: Notice("Omnisearch - Error while creating excerpt, see developer console")
dict.Notice(`Omnisearch - ${n.toAdd.length} f: Notice(`Omnisearch - ${n.toAdd.length} files need to be indexed. Obsidian may experience stutters and freezes during the process`,1e4)
dict.Notice(\"Omnisearch - Your files have be: Notice("Omnisearch - Your files have been indexed.")
dict..log(\"Omnisearch - Those IndexedDb data: .log("Omnisearch - Those IndexedDb databases will be deleted:")
dict..log(\"Omnisearch - Total number of file: .log("Omnisearch - Total number of files to add/update: "+n.toAdd.length)
.log("Omnisearch - Total number of files to remove: "+n.toRemove.length)
dict..setName(\"Show a notification when the: .setName("Show a notification when the server starts")
dict..setDesc(\"Enable caching to speed up in: .setDesc("Enable caching to speed up indexing time. In rare cases, the cache write may cause a crash in Obsidian. This option will disable itself if it happens.")
dict..setDesc(\"Re-executes the previous quer: .setDesc("Re-executes the previous query when opening Omnisearch.")
dict..setDesc(`By default, files that are in:
.setDesc(`By default, files that are in Obsidian's "Options > Files & Links > Excluded Files" list are downranked in results.
        Enable this option to completely hide them.`)
dict..setDesc(\"Folders to downrank in search: .setDesc("Folders to downrank in search results. Files in these folders will be downranked in results.  They will still be indexed for tags, unlike excluded files.  Folders should be comma delimited.")
dict..setDesc(`Enable this if Obsidian often:
.setDesc(`Enable this if Obsidian often freezes while making searches.
        Words shorter than 3 characters won't be used as prefixes; this can reduce search delay but will return fewer results.`)
dict..setDesc(`Enable this if you want to be:
.setDesc(`Enable this if you want to be able to search for URLs as separate words.
        This setting has a strong impact on indexing performance, and can crash Obsidian under certain conditions.`)
dict..setDesc(\"Open and create files in a ne: .setDesc("Open and create files in a new pane instead of the current pane.")
dict..setDesc(\"Navigate down the results wit: .setDesc("Navigate down the results with Ctrl/\u2318 + J/N, or navigate up with Ctrl/\u2318 + K/P")
dict..setDesc(\"Define the level of fuzziness: .setDesc("Define the level of fuzziness for the search. The higher the fuzziness, the more results you'll get.")
dict..setDesc(\"Add a button on the sidebar t: .setDesc("Add a button on the sidebar to open the Vault search modal.")
dict..setDesc(\"Shows the contextual part of: .setDesc("Shows the contextual part of the note that matches the search. Disable this to only show filenames in results.")
dict..setDesc(\"Activate this option to rende: .setDesc("Activate this option to render line returns in result excerpts.")
dict..setDesc(\"Will highlight matching resul: .setDesc("Will highlight matching results when enabled. See README for more customization options.")
dict..setDesc('You can set custom weights for: .setDesc('You can set custom weights for values of header properties (e.g. "keywords"). Weights under 1.0 will downrank the results.')
dict..setDesc(\"Will display a notification i: .setDesc("Will display a notification if the server is enabled, at Obsidian startup.")
dict..setDesc(\"Adds a LOT of logs for debugg: .setDesc("Adds a LOT of logs for debugging purposes. Don't forget to disable it.")
dict..setDesc(\"Navigate down the results wit: .setDesc("Navigate down the results withCtrl/\u2318 + J/N, or navigate up with Ctrl/\u2318 + K/P")
.setDesc("Navigate down the results withCtrl/\u2318 + J/N , or navigate up with Ctrl/\u2318 + K/P")

dict.Changing indexing settings will clear th: Changing indexing settings will clear the cache, and requires a restart of Obsidian.
dict.Omnisearch will use Text Extractor to in: Omnisearch will use Text Extractor to index the content of your PDFs.
dict.Omnisearch will use Text Extractor to OC: Omnisearch will use Text Extractor to OCR your images and index their content.
dict.Omnisearch will use Text Extractor to in: Omnisearch will use Text Extractor to index the content of your office documents
dict.Omnisearch will use AI Image Analyzer to: Omnisearch will use AI Image Analyzer to index the content of your images with ai.
dict.If you have a custom property in your no: If you have a custom property in your notes that you want to use as the title in search results.
dict.Omnisearch can index file<strong>names</:
Omnisearch can index filenames of "unsupported" files, such as e.g. 
.mp4
or non-extracted PDFs & images.
"Obsidian setting" will respect the value of "Files & Links > Detect all file extensions".`)).addDropdown(d=>{d.addOptions({yes:"Yes",no:"No",default:"Obsidian setting"})
dict.In addition to standard <code>md</code>:
In addition to standard md files, Omnisearch can also index other PLAINTEXT files.
Add extensions separated by a space, without the dot. Example: "txt org csv".
\u26A0\uFE0F Using extensions of non-plaintext files (like .pptx) WILL cause crashes, because Omnisearch will try to index their content.
dict.Omnisearch requires <a href=\"https://gi: Omnisearch requires Text Extractor to index PDFs and images.
Omnisearch requires AI Image Analyzer to index images with ai.
dict.Enable this if you want to be able to se:
Enable this if you want to be able to search for CamelCaseWords as separate words.
\u26A0\uFE0F Changing this setting will clear the cache.
dict.Shows a button next to the search input,: Shows a button next to the search input, to create a note. Acts the same as the shift \u21B5 shortcut, can be useful for mobile device users.
dict.Omnisearch can be used through a simple: Omnisearch can be used through a simple HTTP server (more information).
dict.Normalize diacritics in search terms. Wo:
Normalize diacritics in search terms. Words like "br\xFBl\xE9e" or "\u017Elu\u0165ou\u010Dk\xFD" will be indexed as "brulee" and "zlutoucky".
\u26A0\uFE0F You probably should NOT disable this.
\u26A0\uFE0F Changing this setting will clear the cache.
Disable Omnisearch on this device only.
dict.Omnisearch has a security feature that a:
Omnisearch has a security feature that automatically disables cache writing if it cannot fully perform the operation.
Use this option to force the cache to be saved, even if it causes a crash.
dict.Erase all Omnisearch cache data.\n:
Erase all Omnisearch cache data.
          Use this if Omnisearch results are inconsistent, missing, or appear outdated.
Needs a restart to fully take effect.
dict.Enabling this setting could lead to cras: Enabling this setting could lead to crash loops
